</ref> ''Ethics'', on the other hand, are traditionally divided into Aristotelian, Kantian and utilitarian schools. <ref>{{Cite web| url = http://oxforddictionaries.com/definition/ethics?region=us | title = moral | accessdate = 2011-08-14 | work = OxfordDictionaries.com}}</ref> The word ''ethics'' was not first used until roughly the 1400s. <ref>{{Cite web| url = http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/ethics | title = ethics | accessdate = 2011-08-14 | work = Dictionary.com}}</ref> Thus, we can categorize ''morals'' as a code of behaviour which comes from some source of divine revelation, while ''[[ethics]]'' is derived from human or social law or custom.
